name: Aggressive Marketing Blitz
description: A well-funded competitor floods social media and search engines with ads targeting your exact customer base, stealing your visibility.

name: Price War
description: Your competitor cuts prices below cost to undercut you, forcing you to either match their prices and bleed cash or lose customers to cheaper alternatives.

name: Talent Poaching
description: A competitor offers your best engineers and marketers significantly higher salaries and equity, causing key team members to leave.

name: Feature Copy
description: Your competitor reverse-engineers your product and launches your planned features before you can, making you look like the copycat.

name: Negative PR Campaign
description: Anonymous accounts spread rumors on social media and review sites claiming your product is buggy, your company is struggling, or your data is insecure.

name: Counter-Marketing Campaign
description: You quickly launch a counter-marketing campaign to remind users why they chose you and highlight your unique value proposition.

name: Focus on Quality
description: You invest heavily in improving product quality and reliability, betting that superior execution will win over price-sensitive customers.

name: Innovation Push
description: You push your team to ship innovative features faster, trying to outpace competitors before they can catch up.

name: Customer Loyalty Program
description: You create a loyalty program with rewards and exclusive features to make switching costs too high for existing customers.

name: Strategic Partnership
description: You partner with a larger company that can help you compete, gaining access to their customer base and resources.

name: Market Saturation
description: Your competitor spends heavily on advertising, saturating the market with their brand and making it harder for you to get noticed.

name: Exclusive Deals
description: Your competitor locks up exclusive partnerships with major distributors or platforms, cutting off your access to key channels.

name: Rapid Feature Development
description: Your engineering team works overtime to ship competitive features quickly, sacrificing some quality for speed.

name: Community Building
description: You invest in building a passionate community of users who become advocates and help defend your brand against competitors.

name: Technology Superiority
description: Your competitor demonstrates advanced technology at conferences and in press releases, making your product look outdated by comparison.
